snippet: The group said it would continue to pursue peace talks after accusing the military of torturing prisoners and killing 50 militants during the cease-fire.
abstract: Pakistani Taliban say they are ending a six-week-old cease-fire but will continue peace talks with the Pakistan's government.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: The group said it would continue to pursue peace talks after accusing the military of torturing prisoners and killing 50 militants during the cease-fire.

headline.main: Taliban End a Cease-Fire With Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Taliban End a Cease-Fire With Pakistan
